title: Rhubarb, prune and apple pork pies
description: Three stacked pork pies each flavoured with a hint of fruit. Try it as a centrepiece for a buffet or even as a savoury alternative to a wedding cake.For this recipe you will need three springform cake tins (1 x 10cm/4in, 1 x 15cm/6in and 1 x 20cm/8in), three cake boards (1 x 10cm/4in, 1 x 15cm/6in and 1 x 20cm/8in), a mincer, a hand-held blender, three piping bags fitted with plain nozzles (or disposable piping bags with the corner snipped) and nine cake dowels.
ingredients: 575g/1lb 4½oz plain flour, plus extra for dusting
1.5kg/3lb 5oz  boned pork shoulder, three-quarters coarsely minced, one-quarter finely chopped
500g/1lb 2oz pork belly, three-quarters coarsely minced, one-quarter finely chopped
250g/9oz streaky bacon, three-quarters coarsely minced, one-quarter finely chopped
6 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves picked and finely chopped
fresh edible flowers, such as violas and pansies
